official-title.#text: To amend the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to ensure that individuals can keep their health insurance coverage.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: If You Like Your Health Plan, You Can Keep it Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Amendment to the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1251

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Part 2 of subtitle C of title I of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/t:I/st:C/pt:2

text.#text: Nothing in this Act (or an amendment made by this Act) shall be construed to require that an individual terminate coverage under a group health plan or health insurance coverage in which such individual was enrolled during any part of the period beginning on the date of enactment of this Act and ending on December 31, 2013.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (and the amendments made by such subtitles) shall not apply to such plan or coverage, regardless of whether the individual renews such coverage.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/t:I/st:A

text.#text: With respect to a group health plan or health insurance coverage in which an individual was enrolled during any part of the period beginning on the date of enactment of this Act and ending on December 31, 2013, this subtitle and

With respect to a group health plan or health insurance coverage in which an individual was enrolled during any part of the period beginning on the date of enactment of this Act and ending on December 31, 2013, and which is renewed, family members of such individual shall be permitted to enroll in such plan or coverage if such enrollment is permitted under the terms of the plan in effect as of such date of enrollment.

header.#text: Allowance for family members To join current coverage

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (and the amendments made by such subtitles) shall not apply with respect to such plan and such new employees (and their families).
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/t:I/st:A

text.#text: A group health plan that provides coverage during any part of the period beginning on the date of enactment of this Act and ending on December 31, 2013, may provide for the enrolling of new employees (and their families) in such plan, and this subtitle and

header.#text: Allowance for new employees To join current plan

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (and the amendments made by such subtitles) shall not apply until the date on which the last of the collective bargaining agreements relating to the coverage terminates. Any coverage amendment made pursuant to a collective bargaining agreement relating to the coverage which amends the coverage solely to conform to any requirement added by this subtitle or
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/t:I/st:A

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (or amendments) shall not be treated as a termination of such collective bargaining agreement.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/t:I/st:A

text.#text: In the case of health insurance coverage maintained pursuant to one or more collective bargaining agreements between employee representatives and one or more employers that was ratified before December 31, 2013, the provisions of this subtitle and

term.#tail: means any group health plan or health insurance coverage to which this section applies.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall take effect as if included in the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: If You Like Your Health Plan, You Can Keep it Act/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
